title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Wednesday, 17 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: bedfordshire police have confirmed anti-terrorism police were sent to speak to a teenager who wore a `` free palestine '' badge to school in luton .
a luton man accused of terror offences talked about carrying out an attack on soldiers outside military bases , according to the prosecution at his trial .
pay rises at hertfordshire county council will see some senior managers earn more than the prime minister .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for today 's live feed , thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: brian , the st albans train station cat , reunited with owner
text: a cat who lived at st albans train station and was fed by staff has been reunited with his owner after three years .
brian would follow us around the station and never went on the track or boarded a train . ''
the cat , known as brian , was taken to the vet recently for flea treatment , where a microchip was discovered .
brian - whose real name is obama - had been missing since his owner , from london , visited st albans in 2013 .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: protest expected at mk budget meeting
text: a protest is expected before a council meeting in milton keynes this evening where money-saving proposals will be decided on .
among the plans are charging for wardens in sheltered housing , cutting funding for play areas and getting rid of pink sacks for recycling .
the council is looking to cut £ 21m from its spending .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man jailed for sexually assaulting 14-year-old
text: a man in his 20s has been jailed for six months for sexually assaulting a 14-year-old in a shop in bushey .
salim ahamad , 22 , of high road , was found guilty at st albans magistrates ' court yesterday .
police say they were contacted after the girl told her grandmother she had been followed around the shops and touched inappropriately .
cctv was used to identify ahamad , who has indicated to immigration services a wish to return to his country of origin .

documents.title: leigh brightman : disgraced police officer dismissed from force
text: a police officer ailed for arranging to have sex with the runaway teenage girl whose disappearance he was investigation has been dismissed by hertfordshire police .
leigh brightman was jailed on 27 november after pleading guilty to three counts of misconduct in public office .
he was dismissed following a misconduct hearing .
hertfordshire police said he `` betrayed the honour and values of the constabulary in the worst way possible '' .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: challney boys school deny claims they referred pupil to prevent
text: a luton school has refuted claims a student was referred to an anti-terror scheme because he wore a 'free palestine ' badge in class .
author: Luton News

documents.title: human sex trafficker sought by police
text: a convicted human sex trafficker who went on the run while on bail is being sought by police .
florin radu 's 23-year-old victim came to the uk from romania in august 2013 believing she would become a waitress but was forced into prostitution , police said .
the 30-year-old was convicted in his absence at manchester minshull street crown court in october 2015 .
radu was arrested at luton airport on 6 march , 2014 before being charged and remanded , but was later bailed and went missing .

documents.title: woman suffers head injury after a6 crash
text: a woman has been taken to hospital with a head injury following a crash on the a6 at pulloxhill today .
an ambulance crew were called to the scene just before 05:00 , where a vehicle had ended up in a ditch .
the woman was taken to bedford hospital for treatment , but her injuries are not believed to be serious .

documents.title: terror accused described creating road accident at military base
text: a luton man on trial accused of planning a terror attack on military personnel in britain described creating a road accident weeks after driving past bases in east anglia , prosecutors claim .
kingston crown court heard delivery driver junead khan , 25 , would legitimately travel near military bases working for a pharmaceutical firm in letchworth .

in messages to a briton in syria from july last year , mr khan wrote : `` when i saw these us ( sic ) soldiers on road it looked simple but i had nothing on me or wouldve ( sic ) got into an accident with them and made them get out the car . ''
he denies making preparations for attacks between 10 may and 14 july 2015 .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : what 's in the mysterious houghton regis hamper ?
text: here john from houghton regis explains to me what is in a mysterious hamper left on his doorstep .
he 's trying to reunite it with the rightful owner
author: Jonathan Vernon-Smith
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: children 's posters to stop dog fouling
text: schoolchildren from codicote primary school in hertfordshire have designed posters asking the public to up their dog mess .
the signs have been put up in an alleyway near the school .
its hard to ignore codicote primary school 's posters on stopping dog fouling in an alleyway near their school
@ twitterid @ twitterid these are great !

documents.title: two face trial over shefford boys ' home abuse
text: two men charged in connection with the abuse of 26 children at a catholic orphanage in shefford , bedfordshire , more than 40 years ago , are to stand trial at the old bailey on 13 june .
james mccann , 79 , of suffield court , swaffham , norfolk , denies 18 sexual assaults and 48 assaults in connection with st francis boys home between 1963 and 1974 .
john cahill , 73 , of chandos court , bedford , denies six sexual offences against four boys .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: travel : collision m1 northbound near newport pagnell services
text: the m1 northbound is partially blocked due to an accident between j14 and j15 , near newport pagnell services .
traffic is queuing .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : snow , sleet or rain ?
text: whether it comes in autumn , winter or spring , snow is always difficult to pinpoint as bbc weather 's louise lear explains .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: afternoon headlines : luton terror accused mk budget protest
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: policeman 'offered girl , 15 , cash for sex '
text: a former bedfordshire police officer offered to pay a 15-year-old girl cash for sex , a court has heard .

mohammed arshad , 35 , of ferndale road , luton , is standing trial at st albans crown court accused of trawling facebook for young girls to drive around in his car and persuade to engage in sexual activities with him .
a police interview , with a 15-year-old girl , was played to the jury who said the accused offered her £ 50 to have sex with him .
mr arshad denies 22 charges , including one of rape and 11 of causing a child to engage in sexual activity .
the case continues .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: benington schoolboy flies to the usa for specialist cancer treatment
text: brave schoolboy benjamin carter has flown out to the united states for a specialist cancer treatment not available in the uk .
author: Hertfordshire Mercury

documents.title: fire engine donated to kenya
text: officials from kenya visited bedfordshire last week to accept the keys for a fire engine being donated to them by the county 's fire service .
bedfordshire fire and rescue service are sending the vehicle to the meru area in kenya after it was recently retired from use in the fleet .
`` we have a simple philosophy that lifesaving equipment which may no longer be of use here may continue to save lives for many years to come in kenya , '' chief fire office paul fuller said .

documents.title: travel : train delays in bucks
text: there are delays and cancellations on chiltern railways between aylesbury and princes risborough due to emergency engineering works .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: the big picture : inside st albans cathedral
text: the main image at the top of today 's live page shows the inside of st albans cathedral .
thanks to daisy phillips from central bedfordshire college for sharing the photograph with us .

documents.title: teenager criticises school over anti-terror referral
text: a luton teenager 's criticised his school 's decision to report him to anti-terror police for wearing a `` free palestine '' badge .
rahmaan mohammadi , 17 , was a student at challney high school for boys when his support for the cause triggered an investigation by prevent , the government 's anti-radicalisation programme .
he says it 's `` not fit for purpose '' .
mr mohammadi told the bbc he believes teachers `` are not given adequate training '' to report such issues .
the school could n't be reached for comment .
the council said they were `` committed to ensuring that children and young people are protected from harm or abuse '' .

documents.title: mysterious hamper in houghton regis
text: a man from houghton regis has called my radio programme this morning to ask for help reuniting this hamper , left on his doorstep , to its rightful owner .
john told me the packages arrived on sunday and contain water , juice , tissues , chocolates and painkillers .
if anyone knows who sent the parcel or who was supposed to receive it , contact me here .
author: Jonathan Vernon-Smith
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: labour mep reacts to herts council pay rises
text: the labour mep for hertfordshire has reacted to the news of hertfordshire county council officers getting pay rises .
richard howitt tweeted that the £ 10k increases are more than some pensioners in the county have to live on .
on @ twitterid this morning talking about pay rises at herts county council .
some officers are getting £ 10k rises .
but it 's a £ 1bn a year auth
tory # herts pay rise more than 3m pensioners have to live on-in whole year mt @ twitterid @ twitterid some herts cc officers get £ 10k pay rise
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: herts council leader says pay rises simply 'market rate '
text: the leader of hertfordshire county council has said that senior managers are receiving pay rises so that residents continue to receive the same quality of services .
a number of senior managers at the council are set for pay rises worth thousands of pounds .

conservative leader robert gordon said : `` [ manager ] salaries have fallen behind the market and it 's important that we pay them market salaries so that we do n't lose them and undermine the quality of the services we give . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : police misconduct hearing bedfordshire knife amnesty
text: the headlines this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: beer stolen from lorry in hertfordshire
text: five pallets of beer were stolen from a lorry parked on the a10 in hertfordshire , police say .
the carlsberg lorry was parked on the northbound carriageway after the junction at cheshunt for the b198 and a121 at 02:25 on 4 february when the skol cans were stolen .
a hole was cut into the side of the lorry facing away from the road while the driver was sleeping .
police investigating say the theft would 've taken some time as it will have been done by hand .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wycombe wanderers and plymouth argyle fined by fa
text: wycombe and plymouth have both been fined by the football association and warned about future conduct following their league two match on 30 january .
both clubs admitted to a charge of failing to ensure players behaved `` in an orderly fashion '' around the 41st minute , and one in relation to players/and or officials ' behaviour at full-time .
wycombe have been fined £ 2,500 , while argyle must pay £ 3,000 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : heavy rain and sleet this afternoon
text: it 'll be a cloudy afternoon , with outbreaks of rain , some of which may be heavy at times .
some rain may turn to sleet in places and fall as snow later .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police misconduct hearing for hertfordshire officer
text: a police misconduct hearing is due to take place today into a hertfordshire officer who was jailed after having sex with vulnerable women he was supposed to be helping .
leigh brightman , 37 , of tennyson road , hitchin , admitted three counts of misconduct in a public office and two of downloading indecent images of a child .
the hearing will be held in public at bedfordshire police hq .
the court case heard brightman arranged to have sex with a 15-year-old while investigating her disappearance and had sex with two other women he met through his police duties .
he 's serving a four year jail term .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bedfordshire knife amnesty begins
text: a six-week knife amnesty begins in bedfordshire today .
police are encouraging people to surrender their weapons at knife bins across the county .
they will be immune from prosecution for carrying the knife .
the knives may be examined and , if linked to a crime , separate prosecutions could take place .
research has shown you 're more likely to become a victim of knife crime if you 're carrying one . ''
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : impressive sunrise over three counties
text: there are some fantastic photographs of the fiery sunrise over beds , herts and bucks this morning , thanks to our weather watchers .
here are a couple of our favourites .
the top image shows birds flying over hinxworth in hertfordshire , and the bottom one is of a bright orange sunrise in milton keynes .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: herts council pay rises despite local authority cuts
text: a number of senior managers at hertfordshire county council are set for pay rises worth thousands of pounds at a time when their local authority is making cuts .
among the bonuses will be a 3.6 % increase for the director of children 's services boosting her salary by £ 5,000 to £ 143k a year .
the director of health and community services , will get an 8 % rise of £ 10,000 , taking him up to £ 135k .
`` we all agree to keep our top senior officers we do have to pay this .
[ other counties ] are paying their senior officer equivalent to ours much more than [ us ] - we are at the bottom end , '' said leon reefe , leader of the hertfordshire labour group .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: latest headlines : police misconduct hearing body found in watford canal
text: the headlines this morning :
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: milton keynes mum launches parking campaign
text: a milton keynes mother-of-two has launched a campaign against a `` ridiculous '' 20 % rise in parking fees for employees in central milton keynes .
author: One MK

documents.title: herts council pay rises will see staff paid more than pm
text: pay rises at hertfordshire county council will see some senior managers earn more than the prime minister .
council leaders insist the wage increases are essential to prevent staff from being head-hunted by the competitive london market .
the salaries are , however , lower than equivalent roles in other regions .

documents.title: man who 'planned attack on military staff ' had been approached by prevent
text: a luton man on trial for allegedly plotting an attack on us and british military staff received visits from police officers from the prevent programme , which is designed to tackle extremism .
it emerged at kingston crown court yesterday that bedfordshire officers went to junead khan 's home a year before he was arrested , but just left a card because he was out .
the 25-year-old is charged with making preparations for attacking military personnel in the uk .
he 's also jointly charged with his uncle shazib khan , 23 , of making preparations for travelling to syria to fight for the so-called islamic state .
both deny the charges .
the case continues .
author: Gail Sanderson
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: body pulled from watford canal
text: a man 's body has been pulled from the grand union canal in watford .
emergency services were called at 09:00 yesterday .
he was pronounced dead at the scene .
author: Matthew Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: health project for young people in bedfordshire
text: a project to try to improve the health of young people in bedfordshire is set to be launched at center parcs in the county today .
healthwatch is holding a health and well being event at the woburn forest centre .
it 's aimed at trying to reduce the number of preventable deaths among young people aged between 10 and 24 .
the biggest cause of death in this age group is road accidents , with depression and self harm a growing problem .

documents.title: man wanted for attempted murder has bedford links
text: a man wanted in connection with an attempted murder in reading is said to have links to bedford .
thames valley police are appealing to trace q johnson , 21 , who 's also known as ricky or jamie sampson .
it follows the stabbing a 28-year-old man on boxing day 2015 .

documents.title: luton boy questioned by anti-terror police asked if school food was 'made in israel '
text: bedfordshire police have confirmed anti-terrorism police were sent to speak to a teenager who wore a `` free palestine '' badge to school in luton .

rahmaan mohammadi , 17 , who went to challney high school for boys , was investigated last year but has only just spoken publicly about what happened , saying : `` the most crazy thing i did was go to the cafeteria and ask if the food was made in israel . ''
police , after receiving a referral and sending officers round , were satisfied he was n't at risk of radicalisation .

documents.title: morning headlines : police confirm luton boy questioned herts council pay rises
text: the top stories this morning :
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : fine start , but rain and sleet later
text: it will be a fine start for many , but cloud will thicken through the morning bringing outbreaks of rain during the afternoon which will turn to sleet at times and may fall as snow later over the chilterns .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f )
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for the three counties .
until 18:00 this evening , we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather , travel and best of social media for the area .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can tweet us or email us here .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live
